meanings.definition: To launder (money) again in order to conceal its origins.
meanings.sent1: The criminal relaundered the money to hide where it came from.
meanings.sent2: I had to relaundered my clothes because they still smelled bad after the first wash.
meanings.sent3: After realizing he had used stolen money, he quickly relaundered it to avoid getting caught.
meanings.sent4: She relaundered the funds through various accounts, creating a complex web of transactions.
meanings.sent5: The act of relaundering money is a serious crime that can have severe consequences.

meanings.sent1: I accidentally spilled coffee on my shirt, so I had to relaundered it.
meanings.sent2: The hotel relaundered the guest's sheets to ensure they were clean and fresh.
meanings.sent3: She relaundered her favorite dress after wearing it to a messy outdoor event.
meanings.sent4: The rain relaundered the clothes hanging on the line, leaving them even cleaner.
meanings.sent5: He relaundered his socks because they still had dirt on them after the first wash.
